sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Palestinians fire rockets from the West Bank to Israel after an Israeli raid on the town of Jenin sees nine people dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Brazil opens a Holocaust memorial center in Rio de Janeiro to commemorate those who died in concentration camps in Nazi Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Skopje, the capital of North Macedonia which sits in the valley, has been ranked as one of the cities in the world with the highest levels of air pollution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Protests erupted in Gaza following the killing of nine Palestinians in an Israeli special operation in the West Bank town of Jenin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A tenth person was killed in a separate confrontation. Rockets were fired from the Palestinian territory overnight in response to the deadliest single raid in the territory in over two decades. Palestinian officials decided to cease security coordination with Israel in retaliation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A spokesperson for President Mahmoud Abbas says the immediate direction of the Security Council to implement the decision on international protection for the Palestinian people under Chapter 7 and to stop unilateral measures, to urgently turn to the International Criminal Court to add the file of the massacre committed by the occupation forces in Jenin today to the files previously submitted to the court.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In addition to the 10 deaths, 20 people were also injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Israel says those who were killed were armed, although many witnesses argue that several of those who died were civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The raid itself was praised by Israel's new security minister, far-right politician, Itamar Ben-Gavir.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: To mark Holocaust Remembrance Day, a museum has opened in Brazil's Rio de Janeiro to commemorate

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: the massacres in concentration camps under Nazi Germany control.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We know that the Jews were the main victims during Nazism, but in our exhibition we contemplate the Roma, black people, people with disabilities, gay and political opponents for different reasons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The museum brings visitors closer to those who lost their lives during the Third Reich.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: For those who survived, it remains an unforgettable memory of the inhumane way in which they were treated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: survives it remains an unforgettable memory of the inhumane way in which they were treated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: You didn't have a name, you had a number, you didn't exist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: When they called me on the speakers, they called me by my number. You didn't exist as a name for them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The memorial is Brazil's third Holocaust-dedicated monument to be inaugurated in over a decade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: During World War II, many people who fled anti-Semitism in Europe found refuge in Brazil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Tensions have flared up again between Pristina and Belgrade over the contentious issue of car license plates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ethnic Serbs living in Kosovo are complaining that the Kosovan border police are violating an EU-brokered agreement reached last November.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They say agents are telling them they can cross the border, but can't come back unless they change their Serb-registered license plates for a Kosovan one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We still do not have clear information about what is being implemented. Let's assume that the Kosovar government will continue to violate the agreement regardless of criticism by the EU and the United States. We still don't know on what basis they're saying this car can pass and this one can't.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Under the deal, Serbia was to stop issuing license plates with markings indicating Kosovan cities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And Kosovo would not force Serbian residents to re-register their vehicles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There had been fears that the long-standing dispute over car licenses could trigger ethnic violence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Actually, the matter is not about the plates or other secondary matters, but it's about the aspirations of the Kosovan and Serbian governments who actually controls the north of Kosovo, so that in those final negotiations they would have some advantage in the final solution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: they would have some advantage in the final solution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Serbs living in northern Kosovo, where ethnic Albanians are in the majority, don't recognize the Pristina government and see Belgrade as their capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: From down in the Skopje valley, you can see the capital of North Macedonia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In winter, it's often on the list of the Europe's most polluted cities. This year it featured on the world's top 10 list for the worst air quality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This is Gorian Jovanovski, activist and creator of the MyAir app, which, given the pollution problem, has become one of the most popular mobile phone applications in the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: His popularity enabled him to become a member of the city council, where he actively works to improve the situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Skopje is in a valley.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We are a valley city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We are surrounded by mountains, which means that there is not a lot of airflow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Especially during winter, when we have temperature inversion, we cannot let all of this pollution that we generate from the industry, from the households, from the cars, to escape this valley.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And it starts to fill up, and it's like a boiling pot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It gets worse and worse and worse until maybe we have some showers or some wind to clear it up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Skopje, with 700,000 inhabitants, is an industrial city, with many factories built under the former communist system, when environmental standards were not a consideration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: communist system when environmental standards were not a consideration today industrial facilities in the city operate without the necessary controls to meet standards we are turning a blind eye to the industry a lot of this industry is unregulated unmonitored very few industries have 24-hour monitoring systems that are installed even those that have have a lot of holes in the data they're not being regularly checked So we have industry that is completely uncontrolled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The European Commission is closely monitoring the Skopje's pollution levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In several reports, it has highlighted a failure to implement laws required to achieve the ambitions of the green agenda for the Western Balkans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We have laws that are not being implemented.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We have laws that are not sufficient, that need to be changed, that need to be made better. There's a systematic problem of these people not doing their jobs correctly and of course not implementing the laws that are there or not even trying to make the laws better.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Political parties from left and right origins have changed the power in the last decades, but none of them managed to deal with this problem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The citizens' only hope now is the EU membership negotiations that started last year and is now in the screening phase. In Skopje for Euronews, Borjan Jovanovski.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Over a million people took to the streets on Thursday in protest at plans by the French

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: government to raise the retirement age from 62 to 64 by 2030.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The government says the changes are needed to stop the pension system from slipping into billions of euros of deficit in the coming years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Unions are now gearing up for another strike on January 31st and have warned they are prepared to further step up their actions if the government goes ahead with the reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In Haiti, angry police officers blocked streets and broke into the Prime Minister's house in the capital Port-au-Prince in protest at the recent killings of officers by armed gangs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: At least 10 police officers have been killed in the past week. The wave of grisly killings is the latest example of escalating violence in the Caribbean nation following the 2021 assassination of President Jovenel Moise. Two ancient

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: tombs and a pharaonic necropolis were just some of the latest archaeological finds unveiled by Egypt on Thursday. All the items unearthed during a year-long excavation date back to the 5th and 6th dynasties of the Old Kingdom, spanning roughly from 2500 BC to 2100 BC.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Other major findings at the Sakara site just outside Cairo include statues, amulets and a well-preserved sarcophagus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The site is part of a sprawling necropolis that includes the famed Giza pyramids.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I'm so honored. I can't even believe it. I'm so grateful. It's thrilling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A world star will grace this year's Vienna Opera Ball.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Jane Fonda will be the guest of Austrian building contractor Richard Lugner.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Since 1992, the 90-year-old socialite has brought prominent female companions to the annual ball who are usually three decades younger than him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Joan Collins has already shone at his side, Sophia Loren, Kim Kardashian and most recently Ornella Muti.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Organisers are gearing up for this year's event after it was cancelled for two years due to the COVID pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's one of the most glamorous events in Europe and is broadcast to millions around the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Lugner admits his dancing skills and English are a little rusty. However, his date this year may be one of his most formidable yet. Acclaimed actress Jane Fonda is also a prominent activist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: More recently, she's been protesting against climate change and getting arrested while she's at it.
